reviewText: Just for atmosphere alone, I rate this game 10. I cannot praise the immersiveness and evocativeness of the period recreation highly enough. Just driving around nighttime 1940s New-York style streets listening to old-time jazz, blues and other wartime music and seeing all the old-fashioned cars and the snow-covered streets is a wonderfully enjoyable treat, particularly on the PC version with its superlative, realistic graphics. It really gave me enormous joy and pleasure to just drive around listening to the radio whilst completing the early missions, I found the period setting superbly evocative, and the snowy nighttime setting of one of the missions and the music really evoked a lovely wistful feeling as I drove around, it really was very emotionally engaging indeed just from the visuals and music. The design of the city is very convincing, you see lots of realistic-looking streets and sights as you drive around, you almost feel you are watching a film, it's terrific. I loved it. Also the shooting is great in this game, the reaction of the enemies when you shoot them is very realistic, and the ragdoll physics are better and more realistic than in any other game I've seen. So I thoroughly enjoy the shooting also, I find it fun and immersive and satisfyingly convincing shooting the enemies. I rate this game very highly for these three reasons, the visuals, the music, and the shooting. Fantastic.\n\nAs to the story,  game's plot like is basically a mixture of the Godfather, and Goodfellas, you're a war hero, come back from the war and fall into a life of crime with your friend. The open world nature of this game is not the same as GTA. 10/10

reviewText:
This game is fun, but tedious at many parts. One of the greatest aspects of the game is the immersion into the atmosphere. You feel like a true mafia badass shooting people down with a tommy gun and a three-piece suit. The story is a bit too short, and there aren't any side missions to do, so this is a one-way ticket. The story is engaging most of the time, but what really hit me hard, without spoiling much, was the last sequence of the game. If a short gameplay session bothers you, and you want more of a challenge, I highly recommend playing on hard mode with simulation driving on. Be prepared to rage, but succeeding feels very satisfying.


Wouldn't recommend as a GTA-esque game, but as a singleplayer game, this is worth the money.   8/10

reviewText: I've already reccomeded this game, before game reviews were a thing on Steam. But, I am going to reccomend this game again becuase it was worth every penn, that I didn't pay. I got this game for free in a promotion. I thought it would be mediocre, as I got it for free. Never have I been more wrong in my life. This game sucked me in, forcing me to play it over and over again, and again. I would buy the DLC for tihs game, but I don't think I can go through it again, as this game has no point to replaying it. There is no way you can get different outcomes, or even continue playing after the storyline is over. If you can grab this game for under $20, I would tell you to go for it. However, if you are looking for a gang shooter that you can play over and over again, without boredom, go get GTA IV or Saints Row 3. Though it has its downsides, this will forever me one of my favorite games, next to Bioshock: Infinite, for having amazing storylines. This game, by far, has the saddest ending to any game I've ever played, don't just Google it to see what it is, playthrough the game and you will be so sucked in, a tear will come to your eye as you finish it. I rate this game an 8/10. One last note, if you have just bought the game and are reading this, go buy the DLC, as you will find yourself wanting to play more and more of this game, but find yourself bored half-way through your second playthrough.

I'm actually a bit split whether to recommend this game or not, but I ended up as you see recommending it. I followed this game a lot running up to its release and I ended up being both disappointed and not...

The game should have been longer regarding its story and ambitions. Running towards the end of the game it just felt rushed, like it had to be wrapped up which is a damn shame. The story got both ups and downs, and I would be lying if I said it did not grip me at some point. It's well written but it's everything leading up to the ending and the ending itself that kills it.

It still looks great if you ask me. The only thing that disappointed me when it comes to graphics is the damage on cars is not anywhere near the quality of GTA IV which came out 2 years earlier. The gameplay is pretty good and you're punished if you go for a run and gun tactic. The soundtrack for this game is also one of the best I've ever heard in a game.
Outside the story there's not much for you to do in this open world and that takes away from the experience as well. But if all these things are taken under consideration, then the next game, if there's going to be one could be amazing!

Nevertheless it's a really good experience that I would recommend you if you like me, are fascinated by the mafia.

reviewText: Mafia II is an action-adventure video game developed by 2K Czech and published by 2K Games. It was released on 23 August 2010 for the PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and Microsoft Windows;[1][2] a Mac OS X port was released by Feral Interactive in December 2011.[3] The game is the direct sequel to 2002's Mafia: The City of Lost Heaven.[4] Set within the fictional Empire Bay (based on New York City, Chicago, Los Angeles, Boston and Detroit), the story follows a gangster and his efforts to climb through the ranks of the Mafia crime families.\n\nThe game is played from a third-person perspective and its world is navigated on-foot or by vehicle. Players control Vito Scaletta, a war veteran who becomes caught up with the Mafia when trying to pay back his father's debts. The player character's criminal activities may incite a response from law enforcement agencies, measured by a wanted" system that governs the aggression of their response. Development began in 2003

I'm actually a bit split whether to recommend this game or not, but I ended up as you see recommending it. I followed this game a lot running up to its release and I ended up being both disappointed and not...

The game should have been longer regarding its story and ambitions. Running towards the end of the game it just felt rushed, like it had to be wrapped up which is a damn shame. The story got both ups and downs, and I would be lying if I said it did not grip me at some point. It's well written but it's everything leading up to the ending and the ending itself that kills it.

It still looks great if you ask me. The only thing that disappointed me when it comes to graphics is the damage on cars is not anywhere near the quality of GTA IV which came out 2 years earlier. The gameplay is pretty good and you're punished if you go for a run and gun tactic. The soundtrack for this game is also one of the best I've ever heard in a game.
Outside the story there's not much for you to do in this open world and that takes away from the experience as well. But if all these things are taken under consideration, then the next game, if there's going to be one could be amazing!

Nevertheless it's a really good experience that I would recommend you if you like me, are fascinated by the mafia.

TL;DR  Go to Pros/Cons, and Overall/Ratings list section.

I gotta say for this game. It felt so amazing. It just blows out of my mind.

All right, let's talk about what's happening for the Storyline. It's really amazing, well conflict and kind of reminds me the old 40-50's style. As you continue to progress the story, it gets something very interesting and well beyond... until the end that was surprising (not going to tell you).

The Voice-Acting was brilliant and amazing. Especially one of the character voice that reminds me Peter Griffin from Family Guy (Hint: Main Character's best friend).

The Gameplay itself is a Free-Roam of the early 50's city. Everything. It focus from late 40's to early 50's style.
Each Chapter has a mission for you to do the objectives which quite a bit long story, but you don't have to do it and just free-roam whatever you like if you don't feel like doing it. Unfortunately, there are no Side Missions for each chapter as you progress to move on.
For driving, as soon as you speed up the car, the police will chases after you, but it's quite bit of annoying to lose them. You can turn on the Speed-Limiter in order to maintain the same speed sign like in real life. reviewText: Mafia II brings a certain amount of entertainment especially for history buffs who enjoy the world war 2 era and beyond. As far as I can tell it's historically accurate and is a bit reminiscent of Grand theft Auto 4 except for the lack of multiplayer and the sorta closed world. The game spans 10 years of the life of the main character and builds on a deep story of this italian immigrant as his life progresses. The game is sometimes crude and is definitely not for children due to the fact the F" Bomb is dropped nearly 200 times and it features pornographic depictions of playboys which are close to that era. All in all the storyline is kind of short but there are several dlcs you can purchase to expand further into the gameplay and unlike GTA IV the cops do not simply ignore you for petty crimes. Be careful not to hit and run anyone with a cop around or you will face a hefty fine for that time.\n"

reviewText:
I LIKE THIS GAME!!! And it's not because of the Mafia thing, it's not because of the Story, although it IS a good story don't get me wrong. Its THE CAR Mechanics and the little things you can do in town. Thirsty? Go to a bar and get a drink and get HAMMERED, Hungry?
The Diners were you wanna be. But the best thing (to me at least) is when yer driving. Steal a Nice car and go for a spin, take yer Beauties to a Garage and Change the paint Buffout dem scratches, make you're own Custom license plate, and so on.

I think its neat that you're car gets dirty as you drive it and Honestly that hurts me. I HAVE To take it to the Car Wash and get it cleaned every once in a while at a gas station. And although i think its not Necessary but you can fill up yer gas tank with gas at a station just like IRL :D and i find that quite awesome and emersive.

So if you like cars... and Mafia games i guess :/ this is the game for you.
And also when you're driving you can hit a key (its L by default) and you're speedometer will have a red bar on it and if you hit the gas you will only go as fast as the posted speed limit. To me that's quite nice in other games you drive as fast as you want takeing out mailboxes and light posts as you go, and the Cops don't do anything about it. If you speed near a cop in this game They Chase you down ... You know just like IRL.

The Car controls are a little Stiff thoe :/ But compared to all the good things about this game that's hardly worth Griping about. And The best thing YOU DON'T LOSE YOU'RE CAR (unless you drive it off a bridge of course) I stole this NICE old car in the game back near the beginning and i still have it. Its Cherry red Jefferson (the cars name in game) Scratch free, Windows intact. Im gonna see how far i can go with just that car.

reviewText: I got this game during a humble bundle 2k games deal and i totally loved it. The story is about a young guy named Vito and his friend Joe shortly after world war 2 growing up and trying to make it in the mafia etc. It can be classed as an open world game i guess but the best part is really following the story and enjoying the plot, which is epic. The graphics are pretty cool and the whole setting and scenery make the game a joy to play. The car handling and mechanics are cool too. The story and the characters really shine and you become attached to them pretty quickly which makes you want to play the game more. Them open world side isnt really that great as there isnt a load of things to do but that's not really what the focus of the game was i think. Overlall a great game and well worthy of a 9.5/10.

Mixed with some satisfying shootouts and DLC for added play, it's hard to not recommend it.

reviewText:
This game is one of the best Open-World games i know.
The story is very good, so good that i still had fun playing it the 2nd time. (not on this account though)

The Open-World is probably not that big, but it is full of details and was created with lots of thought behind it, trying to make it as immersive as possible.

The Police for example doesnt shoot at you on the first wanted level (driving too fast, crashing into others, etc.) they actually pull you over and give you a ticket, you could decline or accept.

When you rob a store the Police doesnt know what you look like instantly, instead they come to the store and in case your not there just interview the assistant. Only after the assistant has given them a describtion of you, you can be seen by the police. After the interview they will lock down the store and it will be inactive for a few days.

It features exactly that kind of detail I want in a game.

Give it a try, its a fantastic game in my opinion.
